alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:25AM EST until December 18 at 3:51PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Delaware... White Clay Creek Near Newark affecting New Castle County. For the White Clay Creek...including Newark...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Clay Creek near Newark. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding begins into adjacent open fields. At 13.3 feet, Delaware Route 7, Stanton Christiana Road, begins to flood. At 13.5 feet, Businesses on Delaware Route 7 begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 13.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 AM EST Monday was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.2 feet on 11/30/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (5 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date White Clay Creek Newark 13.0 13.9 Mon 5 am 5.2 MSG 14.1 7am 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM EST.
